title: Serabeena Safari Kids Lacing Cards - Colorful Lacing Cards for Kids Ages 3-5 Plus - Lace Up Sewing Cards - Develops Hand-Eye Coordination & Fine Motor Skills - 5 Sewing Animals for Kids with Laces
breadCrumbs: Toys & Games > Arts & Crafts > Craft Kits > Sewing

items.title: Safety Information
items.text: Not for children under 36 months old.

features: Lacing Cards for Ages 3 Plus: This safari kit has 5 colorful laces and wild animals to lace up. Kids can enjoy hours of imaginative play with their animal friends the lion, elephant, rhinoceros, monkey, and crocodile. The shape and texture of this lace and trace for toddlers are perfect for little hands. The glossy finish ensures they last a lifetime!

Develops Hand-Eye Coordination: Help develop their fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination with our double-sided toddler lacing cards that perfectly replicate a sewing motion. Through creative play, they can learn to sew, identify colors and animals, and problem-solve as they practice lacing the cards

Screen-Free, Mess-Free Fun: Reduce screen time and increase educational play using our sewing cards for kids ages 3-5 plus. You can assist their developmental journey with mess-free, engaging, fun lace and trace cards! Keep them occupied at home, in the car, at church, and while traveling with these interactive toddler threading toys

Cute Manipulatives for Preschoolers with Original Designs: Our captivating designs are sure to excite the heart of any child. The cute, vibrantly colored animals and laces are made to draw the attention of kids. It also helps to create a happy environment where they could learn and play at the same time

Sturdy Storage Box: After all the fun, pack the sewing cards neatly in their sturdy, well-designed storage box. It's slender and easily slips onto a bookshelf, into a cupboard, or in their playroom for compact storage. Serabeena's toddler crafts kit is also available in an equally delightful garden version!

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: This is a great set of lacing cards. Bright colors, sturdy cards, fun designs, nice little storage box. My three year old was enthralled from the moment she saw the box and wanted to sit and do all of them immediately. This is our first experience with these things but she learned it easily while still finds it just the right degree of challenging to her motor skills.Two very minor things I might suggest could make it even better would be making a purple string available instead of orange (so that they can each match a card background, the way my three year old immediately wanted to do) and to make the strings maybe one inch longer, to offer a bit more grace and leeway to tiny fingers (they are already long enough to have at least 1.5 inches left over if all of the stitches are relatively taut, but sometimes a toddler will forget to pull it through all the way). It would also be even more adorable if the design had the animals' backside instead of two mirror images of the front, but that's not a flaw, just a little design dream/request for the company to keep in mind in the future.Overall, highly recommend!
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Great Fine Motor Activity, Keeps My Child Busy
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: We've been working with my child's fine motor coordination skills for a while now and they just mastered lacing beads, and are so proud of their work! I was excited to see these lacing cards, as they would be a fun challenge to continue to develop their skills.The lacing cards are a thick cardboard, they feel sturdy and will hold up with some frequent use, as long as your child doesn't get too rough with them! The illustrations of the animals are colorful and fun. My child loves to make animal sounds to match the card she's doing. I appreciate that the box it comes in is also very sturdy and easy to open for little hands. Its great to keep for storing the cards and laces, so items don't get lost or bent. Overall, I'm very pleased with this product and I would recommend it for anyone looking for a fun activity to do with their child.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I got these for my 4 year old to work on fine motor skills. He really likes them. They will help him with patterns as well as he's still learning to put the lace through each hole one after the other. They are fun designs with nice colors. Success!
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I ordered these lacing cards to help my toddler with fine motor skills. The cards look just like the photos, they are thick so you don't have to worry about them being too flimsy for young kids' hands. The lacing strings feel like shoe laces, you can match them to the cards or mix and match (I let my son pick the color he wanted to use with his card of choice).These cards would make a good classroom activity, a morning basket activity for homeschool kids, or as a fun gift. You could also use these as a roadtrip activity or plane distraction toy for the younger kids as well.Tie a knot in one side of the string so it doesn't get pulled all the way through or don't, they're a great simple way to keep kids entertained while working on fine motor skills.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2024

title: Melissa & Doug Alphabet Wooden Lacing Cards With Double-Sided Panels and Matching Laces
breadCrumbs: Toys & Games > Learning & Education > Flash Cards
description: Product DescriptionPractice your letters and build fine motor skills at the same time! This value-packed learning set has a shaped lacing board for every letter of the alphabet. Each one features a colorful illustration on one side and a label on the back, complete with oversize uppercase and lowercase letters. Use the cards as flashcards, match the lace colors to the borders, or string together the entire alphabet—there are lots of ways to learn and play!From the ManufacturerFrom classic wooden toys to crafts, pretend play, and games, Melissa & Doug products provide a launch pad to ignite imagination and a sense of wonder in all children so they can discover themselves, their passions, and their purpose.  Since the company’s founding more than 25 years ago, Melissa & Doug has consistently delivered innovative products that inspire open-ended thinking, encourage kids to see new possibilities, and offer Countless Ways to Play. It’s part of a bigger vision to Take Back Childhood. Because by giving children a true childhood with the space and freedom to explore their world, we give them a path to realizing their full potential!
features: Lacing set with a card and lace for every letter of the alphabet
Includes 26 wooden cards and 26 laces
Each card features a full-color picture on one side; label and upper-/lowercase letters on the other
Lace colors coordination with cards for matching and sorting fun; great for letter recognition, vocabulary, fine motor skills, and hand-eye coordination
Makes a great gift for girls and boys, ages 3 to 6, for hands-on, screen-free play

aPlusContent.title: From the manufacturer
aPlusContent.rawText:
From the manufacturer
Countless Ways to Play 
From classic wooden toys to realistic pretend play sets, Melissa & Doug products spark imagination and wonder through screen-free, open-ended play! We make well-crafted toys that are developed with care to be passed down from generation to generation or shared family to family. When kids pretend with Melissa & Doug, anything is possible! 
Learning Letters 
Colorful illustrations complete with oversize uppercase and lowercase letters. 
Matching Games 
Lace colors coordinate with cards for matching and sorting fun. 
Skill-Building Play 
Great for letter recognition, vocabulary, fine motor skills, and hand-eye coordination. 
With more than three decades of experience, we’re a brand you can trust. Our safe and durable toys inspire imaginative play and are designed to stand the test of time and be passed down through generations. 
We use wood whenever we can because it’s renewable and durable. To ensure the world has healthy forests AND high-quality wooden toys, we’ve committed to planting 10 million trees by 2030. 
100% Screen-Free No screens, no apps, just good wholesome toys for hours of kid-powered fun! Each one of our products is designed to engage children in the joy of imaginative, hands-on play.

aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers find the wooden lacing cards well-made and durable, with plenty of laces that keep children busy for hours. The product is particularly suitable for 3-4 year olds and helps develop fine motor skills, with one customer noting significant improvement in their child's focus and dexterity. Customers appreciate the color variety, with one mentioning how it reduces squabbling among children. While the wooden box is a good idea for packaging, several customers note that it comes without a lid.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: This is a high quality product unlike anything I have seen.  Each wooden card has holes to lace through and one lace is provided for every card.  The lace is long enough that there is usually extra at the end to make a loop for hanging (if a student only goes around the edges.)  The back of each wooden card lists the name of the object and shows the alphabetical letter the item starts with.  When you remove the cardboard spacers beneath the cards in the bottom of each storage hole, the storage spaces are deep enough, that one of the holes can also be used for the strings instead of just the middle section.  My only complaint is that the wooden box has no lid and is therefore difficult to store.There is one object/card for each letter in the alphabet:a - appleb - butterflyc - card - doge - elephantf - fishg - gorillah - hati - insectj - jetk - kitel - lionm - moonn - nesto - octopusp - pumpkinq - quailr - rings - sockt - turtleu - umbrellav - vasew - watermelonx - x-rayy - yarnz - zebraOverall, I bought this for use with my own son since we are homeschooling, but it may be a bit much for an only child.  26 is a lot of wooden cards and not many kids will have the patience or focus to do all of them - even if you only give them one a week, it is repetitious.  I think the best use is to place it out as part of a literacy corner in a classroom where students can choose if they want to do them or not, which ones, and which color strings.BTW, after using them, the cards could be strung together to make a banner or turned into ornaments etc.  The string and be attached and unattached so the cards are reusable even in those cases.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2016

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: As always from this company, good quality and perfect for young hands.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Good cards but the laces are stinky!! That's a P and a U!
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I got these as a new option for a quiet time activity for my 2.5 yr old. She doesn't have the strongest of fine motor skills and I thought this would be an idea for improving on them. So far she doesn't weave the laces around the outer perimeter, but rather sporadically chooses which holes to weave them through until she runs out of laces. It is driving my perfectionist self nuts that she doesn't do the holes in order!  However, since I'm not allowed to be grumpy with a two year old doing nothing wrong, nor can I dictate how she should play with her toys, I've bit my tongue and just keep hoping she'll eventually weave them like I do. The RIGHT way ;)  The cards are very thin, about the width of the shoelaces, but they're sturdy and don't just bend or break with a little pressure.  The laces are colorful and just long enough to go around the perimeter of the cards so there isn't much wiggle room in needing more lace length.  The objects pictured on the cards are obvious and clear so there is no doubt what "word" you're looking at.  I actually wish they would have depicted some more unusual vocabulary words for these rather than the typical "A is for apple" you see in all the alphabet stuff out there, but that is a pretty minor complaint.  It depicts the starting upper and lower case letter together on the back card along with the word of what is pictured.  The box they come in is wood but has no top or anything that seals this shut, much like other Melissa and Doug products out there: once open, forever open. The one thing I didn't notice initially was that the laces have a pretty yucky odor. It isn't obvious, and we played with this a few times before I happened to smell my hands and realized they smelled funky after touching the laces. The cards and box don't smell and the odor is not detectable unless you put your nose up to the laces but I've definitely been having the kiddo wash her hands after playing with this since I realized this little issue. I've only had this open a couple weeks so we will see if the odor dissipates.  I might try to wash the laces, but I haven't attempted that yet.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2017

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Helps with motor skills and a fun way to learn the alphabet! The appearance is great and they are easy to handle and hold! The size is great, the performance is amazing, i wish i had these when i was a kid. The durability is amazing!

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I ordered these lacing cards for my 3 year old great granddaughter to learn how to lace them which is a good way to teach a child about hand sewing. I enjoy sewing and would love to teach her what I am able to when she is a little older.  They cards are very sturdy and brightly decorated with all types of animals and fish, etc. .  Tonight she chose the Gorilla or monkey as she called it to work on.  I would recommend this set for any young child.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: This was purchased for an adult. Mom was an excellent seamstress in her day but battling Parkinson’s and dementia. aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers find this arts and crafts kit excellent for motor skill development, particularly for young neurotypical children, and appreciate that it's easy for 3-year-olds to manipulate. Moreover, the lacing cards are sturdy enough for little hands, and customers like their cute design and colorful appearance. Additionally, the kit keeps children busy and makes a perfect gift for little ones.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Quality and a Quiet activity to do.
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Cards are good size for little hands. Great activity to do with mom & dad on a rainy day. Teach the kids a new skill, just like sewing. Its great to have kits around the house for the kids to learn how to build, cut, put together and use their minds instead of a device. Thinking skills!
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: These cute animal stitching cards are well made. The string included I’d long enough to complete the task. Very colorful and a fun activity. I do believe it is still a little advanced for a 26 month old even though she can string block shapes on a string easily, she hasn’t gotten the concept of alternating the string over and through the hole then under and through the whole. With practice she will get it. I do believe it is more suitable for a 3 year old. Well made and worth the price.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Lacing cards are nice and thick. Very sturdy. Strings are brightly colored—ends have plastic tips like a shoe lace. Very well made of a bygone era.  When opened, it all fits nicely in a sewing box. It’s a great start to safe sewing and crafting for tots & kids.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Our little one has mastered stringing wooden beads on a shoestring so I thought this would be something she would like to do.  The cards are thick cardboard that are easy to handle by little hands.  The cards are a good size and the animals are very colorful.  The holes in the cards are a decent size so little ones can lace them pretty easily.  On the back of the card the holes are numbered 1, 2, 3 with an arrow showing the direction to lace the card.  I'm not sure the hole you start at or the direction of lacing really makes any difference, but it's nice to have that structure to give kids something to follow.  There are 10 animal cards and 10 shoestring laces.  Our little one recognized every one of the animals, but the name of each animal is on the back of each card, in five different languages.  We are enjoying the safari animal set so much I will probably order at least one of their other lacing card sets.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Love this and so did my five year old.

title: Princess Lacing Card Kit for Kids Arts & Crafts, 8 Easy Lacing Projects with Gem Stickers, Paper Art Craft Cards for Toddlers, Fine Motor Preschool Skills, Mess-Free Travel Activity
breadCrumbs: Arts, Crafts & Sewing > Crafting > Paper & Paper Crafts > Card Making Kits
features: 🎀 Make 8 Easy Princess Lacing Cards 🎀 Create 8 beginner lacing art projects with princess-themed cards and gem stickers. Includes tools and instructions for fun crafting time.
✂️ Enhances Fine Motor Skills ✂️ Train hand-eye coordination, early threading, and color matching skills while decorating each card with sparkling gem stickers for extra creativity.
🚗 Great On-the-Go Activity 🚗 Mess-free craft kit perfect for travel, car rides, family gatherings, or quiet time at home. Easy to pack and store in the reusable box.
🔢 Learn to Count 🔢 Flip the cards for counting practice and number recognition, combining creative crafting with early math development for young learners.
🌈 Safe for Ages 3+ 🌈 Made with child-safe tested materials from reliable sources. Enjoy arts and crafts confidently with durable pieces suitable for beginner crafters.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Perfect! Hands-On activity for an active and energetic 3-year-old!
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I bought this Princess Lacing Card Kit for my super-energetic and active 3‑year‑old niece, who usually gets bored with toys in minutes.  However, from the second she opened the box, she was absolutely absorbed in lacing the cards together.  She loved the princess theme as she is very into the Disney princesses right now.The kit includes multiple lacing cards and colorful laces that are just the right size for little hands. What I really love is how it encouraged her to slow down and focus, which is a huge accomplishment for someone with such a short attention span. 😊 This lacing activity has helped her work on her fine motor skills and hand‑eye coordination (something we’ve been working on!) without feeling like learning or "work."She enthusiastically and proudly “finished” each card and immediately asked for more, and even her parents noticed she stayed with this activity way longer than other toys and activities.  This activity is simple, screen‑free fun that actually held her attention, which was a huge win!If you’re looking for a creative, hands-on, screen-free, and educational activity that keeps little hands and minds engaged and active, this is a great choice for toddlers around age 3 and up. Highly recommend!
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Well made item that is easy/fun to use for a four year old girl. I was surprised there were so many lace color choices and lots of gem stickers to decorate with.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2026

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Perfect for the age
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: The biggest hit on Christmas Day!
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I did not think my 3 year old would love these as much as she did! I gave these to her on Christmas and it was instantly her favorite gift. She spent well over an hour decorating the cards with stickers and making fun lacing designs. Now they’re an essential part of our “out and about” bag. They’ve kept her occupied in restaurants, the car, a plane ride, and even in the grocery store. My favorite part about them is that they’re reusable. The stickers don’t lose their stickiness after immediately using them, so you can put them right back on the sticker sheet to use for next time. If they do happen to lose their stick, just peel it off and put one of those adhesive glue dots on the back of the gem. Good as new. And in case you were wondering, they’re fun for all ages! They’ve kept me (27), my husband (31), my 5 year old, my 3 year old, and my grandma (76) entertained on many of our outings.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2026

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Fun set of lacing cards!  Kids love the addition of the gems
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: This is a great lacing card set!  The addition of the gem stickers adds interest to children.  My granddaughter has loved these!  And she will enjoy them for years.  My other grandchildren will also get to enjoy these, they are very durable.  I will say that once all of the gems are applied to the cards, they do not fit into the box that they have come in.  I have a lot of those trendy zipper bags for toys, and I store them inside of one of those.  But it would be nice if the box were a bit larger to accommodate the cards once the gems have been applied.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2026

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: This kept my kiddo occupied for hours!
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: This kept my kiddo occupied for hours! I love that this lacing kit encourages creativity with its vibrant colors and multitude of options. This is a great way to keep kids off screens for hours while they engage with their minds to come up with new patterns and designs. It’s a decent value for the price.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2026
